trans-unit.source: Provides a user interface for selecting and editing an expressions binding collection at design time.

An instance of the ExpressionsCollectionEditor class is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> object that can be used at design time to select and edit a collection of expression bindings, and assign the expressions to a control property.

A designer host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], uses the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditor> class implementations with the ExpressionsCollectionEditor and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionConverter> classes to set the expression bindings for control properties at design time, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlPersister> class to persist the expressions for run time.
Expression strings reference a localizable resource, an application setting, a connection string, or a custom expression type.
The expression string is bound to the control property at design time, and then used at run time to determine the value for the property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor"></xref> class.
Edits the value of the specified object with the specified service provider and context.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method launches the user interface for editing the `value` object.
The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method when you attempt to edit the value of a property that this editor is associated with.
The input service provider is used to obtain any editing services that are required within the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A>.

A designer host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], uses the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditor> class implementations with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionConverter> classes to set the expression bindings for control properties at design time, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlPersister> class to persist the expressions for run time.
Expression strings reference a localizable resource, an application setting, a connection string, or a custom expression type.
The expression string is bound to the control property at design time, and then used at run time to determine the value for the property.

If users cancel the user interface without modifying the expression binding collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method returns the input `value` parameter.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that can be used to gain additional context information such as the associated control.
A service provider object through which editing services can be obtained.
An instance of the object being edited.
An object containing the selected expressions; otherwise, if no expressions are selected, the value object.
Gets the editing style that is associated with this editor for the specified context.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> method returns the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle> value by default.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> is not supported in the specified context, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> returns <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle>.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that can be used to gain additional context information.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle"></xref> enumeration value indicating the editing style for the provided user interface.
